metadata.title: CVE-2024-42258 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mm: huge_memory: use !CONFIG_64BIT to relax huge page alignment on 32 bitmachinesYves-Alexis Perez reported commit 4ef9ad19e176 ("mm: huge_memory: don'tforce huge page alignment on 32 bit") didn't work for x86_32 [1].  It isbecause x86_32 uses CONFIG_X86_32 instead of CONFIG_32BIT.!CONFIG_64BIT should cover all 32 bit machines.[1]https://lore.kernel.org/linux-mm/CAHbLzkr1LwH3pcTgM+aGQ31ip2bKqiqEQ8=FQB+t2c3dhNKNHA@mail.gmail.com/
